subject: Re: Speakjet board
author: purplespacefriend
full_text:
Interesting! You might have to make sure the voltage levels are 
compatible. I made an RNG using white noise, and a discrete 
transistor schmitt trigger. I have my test board all ready with 
audio, and the RNG.

 Frank-S

--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "dead.science" <dead.science@...> 
wrote:
>
> --Hi Frank.
> When my chip gets here I am going to take an emf meter (KII) and use
> the outputs that power the l.e.d's to change the status lines on the
> Speakjet chip.  I am also going to try the white noise via a a to d
> converter.  If the clock pulse is fast enough the white noise should
> be close to true random even after an a to d converter.
> Rob.
> Dead Science.
> - In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, Frank Sumption <purplealiengirl@> 
wrote:
> >
> > 
> >  My Speakjet test board, using a zif (zero insertion force) 
socket,
> jumpers for various modes, and audio amplifiers. I'm thinking use 
the
> buffer full line to gate random numbers in from a white noise RNG on
> the serial line(?). I haven't read enough of the manual yet about 
the
> data, if it needs to be in a certain form or what. Is it just bits, 
or
> is it bytes? I'm all rusty and coroded when it comes to digital.
> >  
> >  Frank-S
> > _________________________________________________________________
> > Need to know the score, the latest news, or you need your
> Hotmail-get your "fix".
> > http://www.msnmobilefix.com/Default.aspx
> >
>
